intro: Tanacetum niveum, commonly known as the snowdrop yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features finely divided, silvery-green leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine and rocky environments. Tanacetum niveum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
